newsitem.title: UK: UK inventor of Yellow Line gets parking ticket.
newsitem.headline: UK inventor of Yellow Line gets parking ticket.

text.p: Pensioner George Musgrave has finally fallen victim to his own invention -- he was fined for parking on a yellow no-parking line 50 years after Britain adopted his idea.
"I don't blame the traffic warden. It is one of those ironies," he said by telephone from his home in the southern seaside resort of Eastbourne.

Musgrave, almost killed as a child when crossing the road, won a safety competition in 1947 when he suggested yellow lines be painted on the side of roads to designate areas where vehicles could not park.
Police adopted his suggestion and Musgrave, a former missionary, was given a two-pound prize.
Now, at the age of 81, the invention has finally caught him out.
"I received the magnificent sum of two pounds then which I have now returned to the community with my 20-pound ($32.40) parking fine," he said.
